result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Bruce Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All conditions of probation shall become conditons of extended supervision should probation be revoked
**AMENDED TO SHOW REPEATER STATUE SHOULD BE 939.62(1)(b)**

miscConds.notes: Shall pay costs to the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office at a rate of $50/mo commencing 2/1/16 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Gary Bruce Campbell in court, in custody.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard on status of this request.  Atty. Klomberg is heard on his objections.  Mr. Campbell is heard.  Court heard, based on test result and Huber that may be lost, Court will not grant furlough.  Court calls agent Jason Fenske by telephone, questioned.  Request for furlough is denied.  Jail takes note that the furlough is denied.

from DOC re: repeater enhancer

Defendant Gary Bruce Campbell in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held regarding sentence. Court heard, based upon facts max penalty should have been 10 yrs DOC, 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES, with enhancer sentence should be additional 4 yrs IC with 5 yrs ES. Atty Klomberg agrees. Atty Wineke agrees. Court heard and amends JOC:  14 yrs DOC Imposed and Stayed - 9 yrs IC, 5yrs ES. Discussion held regarding pre sent credit. Court heard, no pre sent credit to be given, motion denied. Atty Wineke heard, requests electronic monitoring. Atty Klomberg heard, objects. Court heard, will not make decision on request.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

9:01 - Defendant Gary Bruce Campbell in court, in custody with attorney Karl Huebner.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
